alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 26 at 2:40PM PDT until June 27 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: .Warm temperatures will result in rapid snowmelt and increase river and stream flows in areas with sufficient remaining snowpack. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY, JULY 04... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...A portion of east central California, including the following county, Mono County. * WHEN...From Friday evening through Tuesday, July 04. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding impacting rural roads and campgrounds is likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Recreationalists should be prepared to adjust plans due to flood impacts.
